stories.text:
Hey all, I'm looking to level-up my API design game and thought a solid book on the topic could be great, but I'm having a hard time picking out signal from noise in the sea of publications. Especially considering some recommendations out there are a decade+ old, when things have changed significantly in certain areas (like browser tech) since then.
Primarily thinking about web APIs (meaning REST these days) but anything goes. Guiding principles >> "how to build an API in framework Foo"!
Have you got any suggestions? Thanks!

stories.text:
I started coding a few months ago and I found out this tool that has been helping me a lot! I would like to share it with more people and also ask any of you guys know any similar tool with the same function! The tool I have been using is https://metabob.com/

Please let me know if you all like it and if there is another similar tool out there!
